title: Configure inbox
content:
Enable inbox

Inbox is enabled by default for new tenants. To enable inbox for existing tenants, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as a tenant administrator.
  2. Go to Administration > Configuration > Application Settings.
  3. On the Applications Settings page, turn on the Enable inbox option.
  4. Save the changes.

Once the changes are applied successfully, the Inbox option will appears on the main menu, next to the Dashboard.

Configure inbox fields

You can configure the fields that you want to display in the inbox.

View inbox fields

To view the inbox fields:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as a tenant administrator.
  2. Go to Administration > Studio > Cross-record settings > Inbox.

The following table describes the inbox field properties

Field properties
Property name  Description
Name The name of a field.
Multilingual label The text that will appear as a label name.
Logical type

The data type for the field. Supported types are SMALL_TEXT, ENUM, INTEGER, BOOLEAN, DATE_TIME.
Reference to The entity field to which the field is mapped.
System Out of the box fields are marked as a system field.
Enable sort Enables the ability to sort the fields.
Enable search Enables the ability to search the fields.
Required Out of the box fields are marked as a required field.
Tooltip The text to display in the tooltip.
Placeholder

 It is the name of the property.

Add field

To add fields in the inbox:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as a tenant administrator.
  2. Go to Administration > Studio > Cross-record settings > Inbox.
  3. Select Add field.
  4. Enter the values in Name, Multilingual Label, Logical type, Tooltip, and Placeholder fields. If you select ENUM as the Logical Type, enter the value in the Reference to field.
  5. Select OK.

The properties System, Enable sort, Enable search, and Required are disabled by default when you add a new field.

You can only have 15 fields in total including out-of-the-box fields. 

Delete field

To delete the fields in the inbox:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as a tenant administrator.
  2. Go to Administration > Studio > Cross-record settings > Inbox.
  3. Select a record you created, and select Delete.
You can only delete a field if it is not mapped to other record types.

Edit inbox field properties

You can only edit the labels of out-of-the-box fields and if it is mapped.

To edit the fields:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as a tenant administrator.
  2. Go to Administration > Studio > Cross-record settings > Inbox.
  3. Select Edit field.
You can only edit the fields that are not mapped to other record types.

Enable inbox for record type

Out-of-the-box, Inbox has the following fields:

Inbox fields
Field name Description
Assignee The assignee is an individual accountable for completing the work.
Assignment Group The group that assigns the work.
Creation Time The record's creation time.
Record Type  The available record types. Change, Incident, Problem, Request, Task are the record types.
Id The Id of the record.
Owner The owner of the record.
Phase ID The phase id of the record.
Priority The priority of the assigned work.
SLT The Service Level Target set for the particular record.
Title The title of the record.
Last Update Time The updated time of the record.
Title and Assignee are mandatory fields. Ensure the record type includes all mandatory fields needed to map with Inbox.

Out-of-the-box, Inbox is enabled for the five record types listed below.

  • Change
  • Incident
  • Problem
  • Request 
  • Task

To enable Inbox for more record types including custom record types:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface.
  2. Go to Administration > Studio.
  3. Select a record type to enable from the drop-down. 
  4. Navigate to the Inbox tab.
  5. Select the Enable in inbox check box in the Inbox configuration.
  6. Fill in the fields in Field mapping. For more details on the inbox fields, refer the Inbox Fields table in View inbox fields .
  7. Select the Add filter in Conditions if you want to add conditions on the record type as inbox can retrieve information based on the selected record type filter (Optional).
  8. Select Save.
You can enable upto 10 record types in the inbox including custom record types.

You can't map the following record types in Inbox:

  • Article
  • AviatorModel
  • CostAllocationRule
  • DashboardDefinition
  • EntitlementRule
  • ExternalReference
  • ExternalSystem
  • ExpenseLine
  • ExpensePlan
  • FulfillmentPlan
  • GroupTargetSets
  • Holiday
  • HolidayWorkHours
  • ITProcessRecordCategory
  • KPI
  • LicenseMetric
  • NotificationHistoryEvent
  • NotificationHistoryEventDetails
  • NotificationRecipientContent
  • Offering
  • Product
  • ProductCompliance
  • ProductVersion
  • ProductVersionCompliance
  • RecordSltStatus
  • RequestKPI
  • SoftwarePublisher
  • ServiceLevelTarget
  • SurveyResultAnalytic
  • TaskDelegationConf
  • TargetDefinition
  • TargetMeasurement
  • TargetSet
  • UserWorkSchedule
  • VirtualAgentFeedback
  • WorkHours
  • WorkSchedule
